verses.verse: So I say, "God didn't push His ethnic group away, did He?" It could not happen. You see, I am also an Israeli from a seed of Abraham, of Benjamin's family line.
God didn't push His ethnic group away whom He knew beforehand. Or don't you realize in Elijah what the Old Testament writing says (1 Kings 19:10, 14) as he intervenes to God against Israel? Saying,
"Master, they killed your preachers, they excavated and removed your altars, I was left behind alone, and they are looking for me to take my soul."
But what does the divine notice say to him? "I left seven thousand men down there for Myself, some who didn't double over a knee to Baal."
So this is also how in the present time a remaining few have become in line with a selection of generosity.

If it is with generosity, it is no longer from actions of work, or else the generosity no longer becomes generosity. But if it is from actions of work, it no longer is generosity, or else the work no longer is work.
So what is it? Israel didn't obtain any of this thing that it is looking for, but the selection obtained it. The rest became hard as stone.
It is just as it has been written, (in Isaiah 29:10) "God gave them a spirit of numbness, eyes of the 'to not be seeing' kind," and ears of the "to not be hearing" kind until the day today.
And David says, "Their table must become for a trap, for a hunt, for an obstacle, and for a repayment to them.
Their eyes must be made dark, of the 'to not be seeing' kind. And their back, through everything, double it over together with heavy loads."

So I say, "They didn't slip so that they might fall, did they?" It could not happen. But with their infraction, the rescue went to the non-Jews for the "to arouse passion in them (the Jewish people)" thing.
If their infraction is the wealth of the world and their defeat the wealth of the non-Jews, how much more their fullness?
You see, I am talking to you, the non-Jews, based on as much as I certainly am a missionary to non-Jews. I make my job of serving magnificent
if somehow I might arouse passion in my physical kin and might rescue some from among them.
You see, if their casualty is the world's restored relationship, what is their readmission, if not life from the dead?
If the first-part-offering is sacred, the rest of the batch also is. And if the root is sacred, the branches also are.
If some of the branches were torn off, but you, being a wild olive tree, were grafted in among them and became a sharer together of the root and the fatness of the olive tree,
don't brag about how much better you are than the branches. Even if you brag about how much better you are, you don't haul the root, but the root hauls you.
So you will state, "The branches were torn off so that I might be grafted in."
Nicely, with the lack of trust, they were torn off, but with the trust, you have stood. Don't be focused on high things, but be afraid.
You see, if God didn't go easy on the branches that are according to nature, neither will He somehow go easy on you.
So look at God's kindness and severeness â€” certainly on the people who fell: severeness; but on you: kindness if you stay over in His kindness. Or else you also will be chopped out.
If those Jewish people don't stay over in the lack of trust, they also will be grafted in. You see, God is able to graft them in again;

for if you were chopped out of the wild olive tree that according to nature you were branches of and contrary to nature you were grafted into a cultivated olive tree, how much more will these, the branches according to nature, be grafted into their own olive tree?

You see, I don't want you to be unaware, brothers, of this secret (so that you may not be focused with yourselves), that stone hardness out of a part of it has happened to Israel till a time that the fullness of the non-Jews might come in.
And this is how all of Israel will be rescued, just as it has been written, (in Isaiah 59:20) "The One who saves will arrive from Zion and will turn godlessness away from Jacob,"
and, (in Isaiah 59:21 and Jeremiah 31:33, 34) "This is to them, the treaty from My side, when I will take away their sins."
Regarding the good news, they certainly are enemies because of you. But regarding the selection, they are loved because of the Father.
You see, the gifts and the invitation of God are unchanging.
You see, even as you also in the past didn't believe in God but now you received forgiving kindness with the unbelief of these people,
so also these people now didn't believe so that with your forgiving kindness they also might receive forgiving kindness;
for God closed all the people up into unbelief so that He might show forgiving kindness to all the people.
O the depth of God's wealth, insight, and knowledge! How unexplorable are His judgments, and untrackable, His ways!
You see, "Who knew the Master's way of thinking?" or "Who became His counselor" ((Isaiah 40:13)) ?
or "Who gave to Him beforehand and will be repaid by Him" ((Job 41:11)) ?
Because all things are from Him, through Him, and for Him. To Him belongs the magnificence for the spans of time. Amen.
